radiographic_examinations.findings: Heterogeneous, well-circumscribed mass anterior to the right common iliac artery with prominent internal vascularity. Normal testes and scrotum.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Well-circumscribed, solid retroperitoneal mass (2.8 cm by 3.3 cm by 4.6 cm) at the level of the pelvic inlet on the right side, anterior and medial to the psoas muscle. 4-mm indeterminate nodule at the base of the right lung.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Subsequent CT confirmed the presence of the mass; no evidence of other pathologic conditions or abnormal FDG uptake in the lung nodule.

radiographic_examinations.findings: FDG avidity within physiologic limits with no evidence of pathologic uptake.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: MRI of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No evidence of a recurrence after 2 years; follow-up MRI of the chest showed no change in the size of the pulmonary nodule.
